alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 8:24AM EDT until April 29 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Southern Greenville county in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 AM EDT, Floodwaves continued to ripple downstream across the Saluda, Reedy and Enoree River basins. Flooding of low lying areas along these rivers, and select tributaries, such as Grove and Gilder Creeks will linger through at least midday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
